alert.note: Alert for Brown; Kandiyohi; Nicollet; Redwood; Renville; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Sibley, northeastern Redwood, northeastern Brown, southwestern Kandiyohi, Renville and northwestern Nicollet Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 525 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Redwood Falls to 8 miles northeast of Sleepy Eye. Movement was north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Olivia and Renville around 540 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hector, Buffalo Lake and Prinsburg. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 98 and 99. U.S. Highway 212 between mile markers 66 and 101. U.S. Highway 71 between mile markers 82 and 111. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Kandiyohi; Nicollet; Redwood; Renville; Sibley
